name: Shaun Ryder
description: '''Shaun William George Ryder''' (born 23 August 1962) is an English singer, songwriter and [[poet]]. As lead singer of [[Happy Mondays]], he was a leading figure in the [[Madchester]] cultural scene during the late 1980s and early 1990s. In 1993, he formed [[Black Grape]] with former Happy Mondays dancer [[Bez (dancer)|Bez]]. He was the runner-up on the [[I'm a Celebrity...Get Me Out of Here! (British series 10)|tenth series]] of ''[[I'm a Celebrity...Get Me Out of Here! (British TV series)|I'm a Celebrity...Get Me Out of Here!]]''. Ryder collaborated with [[Gorillaz]] on "[[Dare (song)|Dare]]", which peaked at number one on the UK Singles Chart in September 2005, becoming the band's only UK number one single. Ryder is known for his distinctive ''[[sprechgesang]]'' and lyricism.
